SENT.plain: A new syndrome of craniosynostosis is described in two unrelated male children

Associated anomalies include severe exophthalmus; maxillary and mandibular hypoplasia; soft tissue hypertrophy of the palatal shelves; low-set ears with soft, pliable auricles; thoracic anomalies; multiple abdominal hernias; arachnodactyly; and camptodactyly
Functional disorders include infantile hypotonia, developmental delay, mental retardation, and obstructive apnea
An etiology for this recurrent pattern syndrome has not yet been established in the absence of a family history of similar anomalies in both cases
